BOTTOM OF THE PRINT IDENTIFIES THIS STRUCTURE AS THE SEPULCHRE OF SEPTIMIUS SEVERUS THIS WAS NOT ITS ORIGINAL FUNCTION MOST LIKELY IT WAS A MONUMENTAL FACADE TO THE PALATINE HILL IN THE ARCHITECTURAL MOLD OF A SCENAE FRONS IT HAS BEEN PROPOSED ALSO THAT IS MAY HAVE BEAN A MONUMENTAL NYMPHAEUM OR FOUNTAIN BUT NO TRACES OF WATERWORKS REMAIN IN THE AREA SO THIS WAS PROBABLY NOT THE CASE FOR FURTHER INFORMATION SEE RICHARDSON PG 350 S V SEPTIZODIUM THE SEPTIZODIUM WAS DESTROYED IN THE 16TH CENTURY BY POPE SIXTUS V IN ORDER TO REPURPOSE THE MARBLE KNOWLEDGE OF THE INSCRIPTION COMES FROM ITS HAVING BEEN RECORDED IN EPIGRAPHIC SYLLOGES AND PRINTS SUCH AS THIS ONE A 11 UPPER RIGHT 29 BOTTOM CENTER LUCI SEPTIMII SEVERI CAESARIS IN VIA APPIA QUANTUM QUIDAM CONSEQUI CONIECTURA POTERUNT SEPULCHRUM SEPTIZONII TITULO TEMPORUM INIURIA PAENE DISTRUCTUM CETERIS PARTIB VEL CORRUPTIS VEL CONLABSIS NEGLIGENTIA SUPERIORIS AEVI MOTI QUOD SUPEREST MEMORIAM VETERUM PROPAGANTES EFFINXIMUS ROMAE MDXLVI LUCI MUCH AS ANYONE IS ABLE TO DECIPHER THROUGH CONJECTURE THE FORM OF THE SEPULCHER OF LUCIUS SEPTIMIUS SEVERUS CAESAR ON THE VIA APPIA CALLED THE SEPTIZONIUM NEARLY DESTROYED BY THE INJURIES OF TIME WITH THE REMAINING PARTS EITHER IN POOR CONDITION OR FALLING DOWN AS A RESULT OF THE NEGLECT OF THE PRECEDING GENERATIONS WE MOVED HAVE PORTRAYED WHAT REMAINS PRESERVING FOR POSTERITY THE MEMORY OF THINGS INSCRIPTION IS UNKNOWN THE ARCH OF TITUS IS SHOWN HERE RECONSTRUCTED AND FREE FROM ENCUMBERING CONSTRUCTIONS IN THE MEDIEVAL PERIOD IT WAS BUILT INTO THE FORTRESS OF THE FRANGIPANI FAMILY THE ARCH WAS FREED FROM LATER CONSTRUCTIONS AND RESTORED IN 1822 FOR FURTHER INFORMATION SEE RICHARDSON PG 30 S V ARCUS TITI 2 HU 12A A 13 SENATUS POPULUS QUE ROMANUS DIVO TITO DIVI VESPASIANI F VESPASIANO AUGUSTO EADEM IN ANTERIORE EXTERIOREQUE PARTE UNCIALIUM LITTERARUM INSCRIPTIONE REPETITA NOBILIS APPEARANCE OF THE ANCIENT AQUA CLAUDIA BUILT FROM TRAVERTINE THE FAMOUS STREET AND GATE CALLED NAEVIA OR LABICANA TODAY CALLED THE PORTA MAGGIORE PRESERVED BY THE CONDITION OF THE ARCHITECTURE WITH INSCRIPTION IN UNCIAL LETTERS REPEATED ON BOTH THE INTERIOR AND EXTERIOR SIDE RENOWNED UPPER TI CLAUDIUS TIBERIUS CLAUDIUS CAESAR AUGUSTUS GERMANICUS SON OF DRUSUS PONTIFEX MAXIMUS INVESTED WITH THE TRIBUNICAN POWER TWELVE TIMES CONSUL FOR THE 5TH TIME HAILED IMPERATOR 27 TIMES FATHER OF THE FATHERLAND PROVIDED FOR AT HIS OWN EXPENSE THAT THE CLAUDIAN AQUEDUCT BE BROUGHT FROM THE 45TH MILESTONE FROM THE SPRINGS WHICH ARE CALLED THE CAERULEUS AND THE CURTIUS AND ALSO THAT THE ANIO NOVUS BE BROUGHT FROM THE 62ND MILESTONE INTO THE CITY OF ROME IN UTROQUE LATERE TI BERIUS CLAUDIUS DRUSI F ILIUS CAISAR AUGUSTUS GERMANICUS PONTIF EX MAXIM US TRIBUNICIA POTESTATE X I I CO N S UL V IMPERATOR X X V I ET VI P 3798 ET VI P 4365 MIDDLE IMP CAESAR VESPASIANUS AUGUST PONTIF MAX TRIB POT II IMP VI COS III DESIG IIII P P AQUAS CURTIAM ET CAERULEAM PERDUCTAS A DIVO CLAUDIO ET POSTEA INTERMISSAS DILAPSAS QUE PER ANNOS NOVEM SUA IMPENSA URBI RESTITUIT IMPERATOR CAESAR VESPASIANUS AUGUSTUSTUS PONTIFEX MAXIMUS TRIBUNICIA POTESTATE II IMPERATOR VI CONSUL III DESIGNATUS IIII PATER PATRIAE AQUAS CURTIAM ET CAERULEAM PERDUCTAS A DIVO CLAUDIO ET POSTEA INTERMISSAS DILAPSAS QUE PER ANNOS NOVEM SUA IMPENSA URBI RESTITUIT IMP ERATOR CAESAR VESPASIANUS AUGUST US PONTIF EX MAX IMUS TRIB UNICIA POT ESTATE II IMP ERATOR VI CO N S UL III DESIG NATUS IIII P ATER P ATRIAE AQUAS CURTIAM ET CAERULEAM PERDUCTAS A DIVO CLAUDIO ET POSTEA INTERMISSAS DILAPSASQUE PER ANNOS NOVEM SUA IMPENSA URBI RESTITUIT THE EMPEROR CAESAR VESPASIAN AUGUSTUS PONTIFEX MAXIMUS INVESTED WITH THE TRIBUNICAN POWER TWO TIMES HAILED IMPERATOR SIX TIMES CONSUL ELECT FOR THE 4TH TIME FATHER OF THE FATHERLAND RESTORED AT HIS OWN EXPENSE FOR THE CITY OF ROME THE AQUEDUCTS LED FROM THE CURTIUS AND CAERULUS BY THE DIVINE CLAUDIUS AND SINCE INTERRUPTED AND RUINED FOR NINE YEARS IN UTROQUE LATERE IMP ERATOR CAESAR VESPASIANUS ITUS CAESAR DIVI F ILIUS VESPASIANUS AUGUSTUS PONTIFEX MAXIMUS TRIBUNIC IA POTESTATE X IMPERATOR XVII PATER PATRIAE CENSOR CO N S UL VIII AQUAS CURTIAM ET CAERULEAM PERDUCTAS A DIVO CLAUDIO ET POSTEA A DIVO VESPASIANO PATRE SUO URBI RESTITUTAS CUM A CAPITE AQUARUM A SOLO VETUSTATE DILAPSAE ESSENT NOVA FORMA REDUCENDAS SUA IMPENSA CURAVIT EMPEROR TITUS CLAUDIUS CAESAR VESPASIAN AUGUSTUS SON OF THE DIVINE VESPASIAN PONTIFEX MAXIMUS INVESTED WITH THE TRIBUNICAN POWER TEN TIMES HAILED IMPERATOR SEVENTEEN TIMES FATHER OF THE FATHERLAND CENSOR CONSUL FOR THE 8TH TIME AT HIS OWN EXPENSE PROVIDED THAT THE CURTIAN AND CAERULEAN WATERS THAT HAD BEEN BROUGHT FORTH BY THE DIVINE CLAUDIUS AND AFTERWARDS HAD BEEN RESTORED FOR THE CITY OF ROME BY HIS FATHER THE DIVINE VESPASIAN SINCE THEY HAD FALLED INTO DISREPAIR AT THE SOURCE OF THE WATERS FROM THE VERY FOUNDATION BECAUSE OF AGE BE BROUGHT BACK AGAIN BUT IN A NEW CHANNEL IN UTROQUE LATERE IMP ERATOR T ITUS CAESAR DIVI F ILIUS VESPASIANUS AUGUSTUS PONTIFEX MAXIMUS TRIBUNIC IA POTESTATE X IMPERATOR X V I I PATER PATRIAE CENSOR CO N SUL V I II AQUAS CURTIAM ET CAERULEAM PERDUCTAS A DIVO CLAUDIO ET POSTEA A DIVO VESPASIANO PATRE SUO URBI INSCRIPTION ON THE PANTHEON IN THE FIRST LINE OF THIS INSCRIPTION THE NAME OF THE EMPEROR IS GIVEN AS LDQUO L UCIUS SEPTIMIUS SEVERUS PIUS PERTINAX HELLIP RDQUO IN THE ACTUAL INSCRIPTION ON THE PANTHEON THE NAME LDQUO SEVERUS RDQUO DOES NOT APPEAR IN THE SAME LINE LDQUO AUG USTUS RDQUO IS MISSING AFTER LDQUO PERTINAX RDQUO AND LDQUO PARTHICUS RDQUO SHOULD BE LDQUO PARTHICUS MAXIMUS RDQUO ALSO IN LINE ONE LDQUO PONT IFEX MAX IMUS TRIB UNICIA POT ESTATE XI RDQUO SHOULD BE LDQUO PONTIF EX MAX IMUS TRIB UNICIA POTEST ATE X RDQUO IN THE SECOND LINE LDQUO TRIB UNICIA POTEST ATE V RDQUO SHOULD BE LDQUO TRIB UNICIA POTESTAT E V RDQUO COMPARE WITH SOURCE TEXT BELOW IMP ERATOR CAES AR L UCIUS SEPTIMIUS PIUS PERTINAX AUG USTUS ARABICUS ADIABENICUS PARTHICUS MAXIMUS PONTIF EX MAX IMUS MAXIMUS INVESTED WITH THE TRIBUNICIAN POWER ELEVEN TIMES CONSUL THREE TIMES FATHER OF THE FATHERLAND PROCONSUL AND EMPEROR CAESAR MARCUS AURELIUS ANTONINUS PIUS FELIX AUGUSTUS INVESTED WITH THE TRIBUNICIAN POWER FIVE TIMES CONSUL PROCONSUL RESTORED THE PANTHEON RUINED BY AGE WITH GREATEST CARE LOWER RIGHT LABRUM EX PORPHYRITE ET DUOS EX OPHITE LEONES AEGYPTIIS NOTIS ILLISTRES EX PROSXIMIS UT OPINOR AGRIPPAE AC NERONIS THERMIS IN CELEBRIOREM ET AMPLIOREM LOCUM PII PONTIFICES MAXIMI NE SITU SQUALLOREVE IACERENT PROPTER PANTHEUM ERIGI COLLOCARIQUE IUSSERUNT LABRUM EX PORPHYRITE ET DUOS EX COLLOCARIQUE IUSSERUNT LEST THEY REMAIN LYING IN A DESERTED PLACE THE PIUS POPES ORDERED THAT THIS BASIN MADE OF PORPHYRY AND THESE TWO EGYPTIAN LIONS OF SERPENTINO MARBLE FAMOUS AND ILLUSTRIOUS WHICH ARE AS I JUDGE FROM THE NEARBY BATHS OF AGRIPPA AND NERO BE REMOVED AND ERECTED NEAR THE PANTHEON LOWER CENTER ANT LAFRERI ROMAE 1549 ANTONIUS LAFRERI ROMAE 1549 ANT ONIUS LAFRERI ROMAE 1549 ANTONIO VITELLIA QUINTUS FABIUS HONORATUS AND TITUS ANNAEUS PLACIDUS BROUGHT TO COMPLETION HAVING BEEN THE UNDERTAKING AT THAT TIME OF HIS DEATH OF CLAUDIA REGILLA HIS WIFE AND ANTIA MARCELLINA HIS DAUGHTER EXHIBENDIS IMPERATORE CAESARE AUGUGUSTO SUASU POST BELLA CIVILIA PACE POPULI ROMANI TERRA MARIQUE PARTA NOBILISSIMA COLONIA VERONA OPERE RUSTICO IN FORO BOARIO EXTRA URBIS MOENIA AERE PUBLICO COLLOCAVIT UNUM OMNIUM QUAE NOBIS ANTIQUITAS RELIQUIT CIVIUM PERPETUA DILIGENTIA ET QUANTUM HUMANA OPE PRAESTARI POTUIT MAGIS A TEMPORUM INIURIA PRAESERUATUM ANTERIOREM ENIM PORTICUUM PARTEM QUAM ALAM VOCANT INGENTI TERREMOTU QUASSATAM ANNO SALUTIS MCXVII CORRUISSE ANNALIBUS VERONENSIUM PRODITUM EST AMPHITHEATRI VERONEN SIS DILIGENS ET ACCURATA DELINEATIO QUOD LUDIS PUBLICIS GLADIATORIO MUNERI ET FERARUM VENATIONIB US EXHIBENDIS IMP ERATORE CAES ARE AUG UGUSTO SUASU POST BELLA CIVIL IA PACE POP ULI RO MANI TERRA MARIQ UE PARTA NOBILISSIMA COLONIA VERONA OPERE RUSTICO IN FORO BOARIO EXTRA URB IS MOENIA AERE PUBLICO COLLOCAVIT UNUM OMNIUM QUAE NOBIS ANTIQUITAS RELIQUIT CIVIUM PERPETUA DILIGENTIA ET QUANTUM HUMANA OPE PRAESTARI POTUIT MAGIS A TEMPORUM INIURIA PRAESERUATUM ANTERIOREM ENIM PORTICUUM PARTEM QUAM ALAM VOCANT INGENTI TERREMOTU QUASSATAM ANNO SALUT IS MCXVII CORRUISSE ANNALIBUS VERONENSIUM PRODITUM EST A MOST ACCURATE AND CAREFUL SKETCH OF THE AMPHITHEATRE OF VERONA HELLIP WITH PEACE HAVING BEEN BROUGHT FORTH ON LAND AND SEA FOR THE ROMAN PEOPLE AFTER THE CIVIL WARS THE MOST NOBLE COLONY VERONA ON THE ADVICE OF THE EMPEROR CAESAR AUGUSTUS ARRANGED FOR THE EXHIBITION OF PUBLIC GAMES GLADIATORIAL OFFERINGS AND WILD BEAST HUNTS WITH PUBLIC MONEY IN THE CATTLE MARKET OUTSIDE THE WALLS OF THE CITY FOR RURAL NEED ONE OF ALL THE MONUMENTS WHICH ANTIQUITY HAS HANDED DOWN TO US BY THE PERPETUAL DILIGENCE OF CITIZENS AND WHICH COULD BE PRESERVED BY HUMAN EFFORT GREATLY PROTECTED FROM THE INJURIES OF TIME IT WAS EVEN RECORDED IN THE ANNALS OF VERONA THAT THE PREVIOUS SIDE OF THE COLONNADE CALLED THE WING SHAKEN BY A HUGE EARTHQUAKE HAD COLLAPSED LOWER RIGHT ROMAE ANNO MDLX ANTON II LAFRERII SEQUANI FORMIS AD GENITIVUM ARCHETYPUM FIDELISSIME EXPRESSA ROME SPECIAL ON THE OCCASION OF THIS AFFAIR A COLUMN WITH BEAKED PROWS WAS PLACED IN THE ROMAN FORUM BY ORDER OF THE SENATE AND VARIOUS AUTHORITIES BROUGHT FORTH A STATUE TO HIM HIS STYLOBATE COLUMN IN FORMER YEARS WAS REMOVED FROM THE RUBBLE OF THE CAPITOLINE HILL FACING THE FORUM NOW HOWEVER IT HAS BEEN MOVED TO THE CAPITOL BY THE FAVOR OF THOSE WHO STUDY ANCIENT THINGS WHERE ITS FORM WAS RESTORED WITH THOUGH ON THE ACTUAL MONUMENT IT IS WRITTEN LDQUO SENATUS POPULUSQUE ROMANUS RDQUO IN ADDITION LDQUO GERMANIC O RDQUO SHOULD BE ABBREVIATED TO LDQUO GERM ANICO RDQUO LDQUO PONT IFICI MAX IMO RDQUO SHOULD BE LDQUO PONTIF ICI MAXIMO RDQUO THE PRINT IS MISSING LDQUO IMP ERATORI VI RDQUO AFTER LDQUO TRIB UNICIA POT ESTATE XVII RDQUO IN THE FOURTH LINE AND IN THE FINAL LINE IT IS MISSING LDQUO TANT IS OPER IBUS RDQUO AFTER LDQUO LOCUS RDQUO COMPARE WITH SOURCE TEXT BELOW SENATUS POPOLUSQUE ROMANUS IMP ERATORI CAESARI DIVI NERVAE F ILIO NERVAE TRAIANO AUG USTO GERM ANICO DACICO PONTIF ICI MAXIMO RESTITUERUNT IMPERATOR CAESAR LUCIUS SEPTIMIUS SEVERUS PIUS PERTINAX ARABICUS ADIABENICUS PARTHICUS PONTIFEX MAXIMUS TRIBUNICIA POTESTATE XI CONSUL III PATER PATRIAE PROCONSUL ET IMPERATOR CAESAR MARCUS AURELIUS ANTONINUS PIUS FELIX AUGUSTUS TRIBUNICIA POTESTATE V CONSUL PROCONSUL PANTHEUM VETUSTATE CORUPTUM CUM OMNI CULTU RESTITUERUNT IMP ERATOR CAES AR L UCIUS SEPTIMIUS SEVERUS PIUS PERTINAX ARABICUS ADIABENICUS PARTHICUS PONT IFEX MAX IMUS TRIB UNICIA POT ESTATE XI CO N S UL III P ATER P ATRIAE PROCO N S UL ET IMP ERATOR CAES AR M ARCUS AURELIUS ANTONINUS PIUS FELIX AUG USTUS TRIB UNICIA POTEST ATE V CO N S UL PROCO N S UL PANTHEUM VETUSTATE CORUPTUM CUM OMNI CULTU RESTITUERUNT NOTE THERE ARE SEVERAL PLACES IN WHICH THIS INSCRIPTION AS GIVEN IN THE PRINT DIFFERS FROM THE ORIGINAL INSCRIPTION ON THE PANTHEON IN THE FIRST LINE OF THIS INSCRIPTION THE NAME OF THE EMPEROR IS GIVEN AS LDQUO L UCIUS SEPTIMIUS SEVERUS PIUS PERTINAX HELLIP RDQUO IN THE ACTUAL INSCRIPTION ON THE PANTHEON THE NAME LDQUO SEVERUS RDQUO DOES NOT APPEAR IN THE SAME LINE LDQUO AUG USTUS RDQUO IS MISSING AFTER LDQUO PERTINAX RDQUO AND LDQUO PARTHICUS RDQUO SHOULD BE LDQUO PARTHICUS MAXIMUS RDQUO ALSO IN LINE ONE LDQUO PONT IFEX MAX IMUS TRIB UNICIA POT ESTATE XI RDQUO SHOULD BE LDQUO PONTIF EX MAX IMUS TRIB UNICIA POTEST ATE X RDQUO IN THE SECOND LINE LDQUO TRIB UNICIA POTEST ATE V RDQUO SHOULD BE LDQUO TRIB UNICIA POTESTAT E V RDQUO AND LDQUO CORUPTUM RDQUO SHOULD BE LDQUO CORRUPTUM RDQUO COMPARE WITH SOURCE TEXT BELOW IMP ERATOR CAES AR L UCIUS SEPTIMIUS PIUS PERTINAX AUG USTUS ROMA VESTIGII DEL TEMPIO DELLA PACE EDIFICATO DA VESPASIANO IMPERATORE QUAL SECONDO GLI AUTORI ET VESTIGII CHE SE VEDENO FU UNO DI MAGGIORI DI PUI BELLI ET RICCHI TEMPII DI ROMA PERCHE IVI FURO NO RIPOSTO TUTTI LE RICHEZZE ET ORNAMENTI DEL TEMPIO DI SALOMONE CHE RECHO TITTO NEL SUO TRIOMPHO IN ROMA ORA IN QUSTO TEMPIO SI VEDE NELLE VOLTE BELLISS IM I PARTIMENTI DI STUCCO VI SI VEDE ANCO UNA COLONNA DI MARMORO IN OPERA D ORDINE CORINTIO CON LI SUI MENBRI LA MAGGIORE DE GLI ALTRI CHE SI VEDE IN ROMA REMAINS OF THE TEMPLE OF PEACE BUILT BY EMPEROR VESPASIAN WHICH ACCORDING TO THE AUTHORS AND VISIBLE REMAINS WAS ONE OF THE GREATEST MOST BEAUTIFUL AND MOST LAVISH TEMPLES OF ROME BECAUSE THERE THEY HAD PLACED ALL THE RICHES AND ORNAMENTS OF THE TEMPLE OF SOLOMON WHICH TITUS ACQUIRED IN HIS TRIUMPH IN ROME NOW IN THIS TEMPLE THERE ARE IN THE VAULTS BEAUTIFUL COFFERS OF PLASTER THERE IS ALSO A MARBLE COLUMN OF THE CORINTHIAN ORDER WITH ITS COMPONENTS THE GREATEST OF ALL THE OTHERS THAT ONE SEES IN ROME ROME SPECIAL COLLECTIONS RESEARCH CENTER UNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO DG62 5 L2 CHICAGO UNITED STATES 21 5 X 38 0 CM SHEET TRIMMED TO PLATE MARK 21 5 38 0 21 5 38 0 ASHBY THOMAS LDQUO QUESTI SIMILLI EDIFICII SERVIVANO PER NEGOTIATORI DE LITTE OVER DI MERCHANTI ET ANCO PER PIAZZE DA VENDERE DIVERSE COSE PER SERVITIO DELLA VITA HUMANA REMAINS OF THE FORUM OF THE EMPEROR NERVA WHICH WAS ALSO CALLED FORO TRANSITORIO BECAUSE IT WAS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE OTHER FORUMS AND THROUGH IT ONE COULD GO FROM THE FORUM OF CAESAR TO THE FORUM OF AUGUSTUS AND THE ROMAN FORUM THIS EDIFICE WAS MADE WITH VERY BEAUTIFUL ARCHITECTURE ADORNED WITH BEAUTIFUL COLUMNS AND STATUES OF ILLUSTRIOUS MEN TODAY THERE ARE NO REMAINS OF A FORUM MORE COMPLETE THAN THIS ANYWHERE IN ROME THESE SIMILAR EDIFICES SERVED NEGOTIATORS OF SUITS OR MERCHANTS AND ALSO AS PIAZZAS IN WHICH TO SELL DIFFERENT THINGS TO SERVE DAILY LIFE ROME SPECIAL COLLECTIONS RESEARCH CENTER UNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO DG62 5 L2 PORTICO OF THE IONIC ORDER AND DECORATED WITH 48 NICHES WHICH IS 12 PER SIDE TODAY IT IS STRIPPED OF ITS ORNAMENTATION NEAR THIS AT THE LETTER A IS A SMALL SQUARE ARCH DECORATED WITH EIGHT CORINTHIAN PILASTERS THIS ARCH WAS ERECTED BY THE SILVERSMITHS AND MERCHANTS OF THE AFOREMENTIONED FORUM BOARIUM IN HONOR OF THE EMPERORS SEPTIMUS AND MARCUS AURELIUS ONE IS STILL ABLE TO SEE AT THE LETTER B AN ANCIENT WATERWAY THAT WAS DISCOVERED UNDERGROUND WHERE FOR PUBLIC BENEFIT THERE WERE MADE BEAUTIFUL FOUNTAINS WITH A BASIN AND THIS PIAZZA IS CALLED THE PIAZZA OF THE FOUNTAIN OF SAINT GEORGE BECAUSE PORTRAIT OF JACOB SCHLETZER TO WHOM THIS PARTICULAR EDITION WAS DEDICATED APPEARS ON ENGRAVING N 2 OF THE SET B 248 ALTHOUGH THE TEXT AT THE BOTTOM OF THE PRINT IDENTIFIES THIS STRUCTURE AS THE SEPULCHRE OF SEPTIMIUS SEVERUS THIS WAS NOT ITS ORIGINAL FUNCTION MOST LIKELY IT WAS A MONUMENTAL FACADE TO THE PALATINE HILL IN THE ARCHITECTURAL MOLD OF A SCENAE FRONS IT HAS BEEN PROPOSED ALSO THAT IS MAY HAVE BEAN A MONUMENTAL NYMPHAEUM OR FOUNTAIN BUT NO TRACES OF WATERWORKS REMAIN IN THE AREA SO THIS WAS PROBABLY NOT THE CASE FOR FURTHER INFORMATION SEE RICHARDSON PG 350 S V SEPTIZODIUM THE SEPTIZODIUM WAS DESTROYED IN THE 16TH CENTURY BY POPE SIXTUS V IN ORDER TO REPURPOSE THE MARBLE KNOWLEDGE OF THE INSCRIPTION COMES FROM ITS HAVING BEEN RECORDED IN EPIGRAPHIC SYLLOGES AND PRINTS SUCH AS THIS ONE B 259 LOWER RIGHT 13 LOWER LEFT VESTIGII DEL SETTIZONIO DI SEVERO IMPERATORE CHE FU UN SEPOLCRO CHE EGLI SI EDIFICO SOPRA LA STRADA APPIA NON PER ALTRA CAGIONE SE NON CHE QUELLI CHE VENIVANO DI AFRICA LO HAVESSERO SU GLI OCCHI QUESTO EDIFITIO FACEVA FACE IA A MEZZOGIORNO ET E TUTTO DI OPERA CORINTHIA CON BELLISSIMI COLONNI DI VARII PIETRE MISCHIE PARTE STRIATE ET PARTE SANZA CON LI LORO MENBRI DI MARMORO FU CHIAMATO ANCO SETTIZOLIO DA SETTE SOLARI CHE AVEVA ET CHE SI VEDE NELLA PARTE DI DIETRO IL VULGO LO CHIAMO LA SCOLA DI VIRGILIO REMAINS OF THE SEPTIZONIUM OF EMPEROR SEVERUS WHICH WAS A SEPULCHER THAT HE BUILT HIMSELF ABOVE VIA APPIA FOR NO OTHER REASON THAN SO THAT EVERYONE COMING FROM AFRICA WOULD BE ABLE TO SEE IT THIS EDIFICE WAS MADE FACING SOUTH AND IT IS ALL OF THE CORINTHIAN ORDER WITH BEAUTIFUL COLUMNS OF VARIOUS MIXED STONES PART STREAKED AND PART WITHOUT STREAKS WITH THEIR COMPONENTS OF MARBLE IT WAS ALSO CALLED THE SEPTIZODIUM BECAUSE OF THE SEVEN SUNS THAT IT HAD AND WHICH ARE VISIBLE IN PART AT THE BACK THE PEOPLE CALL IT THE SCHOOL OF VIRGIL C TRIB POTU COS FORTUNATISSIMUS NOBILISSIMUSQUE C TRIBUNICIA POTUSTATE CONSUL FORTUNATISSIMUS CONSTANTINE WHICH IS TODAY THE MOST COMPLETE OF ALL THE OTHERS WHERE ONE IS ABLE TO REALIZE THE EXTENT OF DECLINE INTO WHICH SCULPTURE HAD COME BECAUSE THIS ARCH WAS MADE OF THE ORNAMENTATION TAKEN FROM THE ARCH OF TRAJAN AT THE LETTER A IS A PIECE OF BRICK WALL IN THE FORM OF A META WHICH THE ANCIENTS CALLED THE META SUDANS BECAUSE FROM THIS META CAME LARGE AMOUNTS OF WATER FOR PUBLIC USE AT THE LETTER B ARE THE REMAINS OF THE ARCH OF TITUS WHICH IS COMPOSED OF A MORE BEAUTIFUL STYLE OF ARCHITECTURE THAN ALL THE OTHERS AND ON IT ONE SEES SCULPTED HIS TRIUMPHAL PROCESSION ROME SPECIAL AFOREMENTIONED PLACE WAS OF INESTIMABLE BEAUTY OTHERS WOULD HAVE IT THAT THE AFOREMENTIONED BATHS WERE CONNECTED WITH THOSE OF TRAJAN ONE IS NO LONGER ABLE TO JUDGE HOW THEY WERE BECAUSE THESE PLACES OGGI L ANTONIANA REMAINS OF THE BATHS OF ANTONINUS CARACALLA FROM THE OUTER PART WHICH FACES SOUTH WHICH WAS BEGUN BY THIS EMPEROR AND FURNISHED AND ADORNED BY ALEXANDER SEVERUS THEY WERE SITUATED AT THE BASE OF THE AVENTINE HILL AROUND THE REGION OF THE PUBLIC POOL AND THEY WERE LARGE AND BEAUTIFUL AND WELL COMPOSED IN ARCHITECTURE ADORNED WITH LARGE COLUMNS OF VARIOUS MIXED STONES PRINT 20 B266 OF PAINTING SCULPTURE PLASTER AND MOSAIC THE VAULTS WERE CONSTRUCTED WITH PUMICE STONE TO BE LIGHTER AND GIVE GREAT VALUE TO THE EDIFICE TODAY THIS PLACE IS STRIPPED OF ALL ITS AFOREMENTIONED ORNAMENTATION AND ONE DOES NOT SEE ANYTHING BUT BRICK WALLS WHICH SPEAK TO THE GRANDNESS AND BEAUTY OF THIS BUILDING THE PEOPLE CALL IT THE ANTONIANA ROME SPECIAL COLLECTIONS RESEARCH CENTER TUTTO D UN PEZZO LEQUALLI IL CAR DINA LE FARNESE A FATTO DRIZZARE OGGIDI NEL SUO PALAZZO REMAINS OF THE BATHS OF ANTONINUS CARACALLA OF THE INNER PART WHICH WAS AN ATRIUM OR RATHER A COURTYARD WITH A CORRIDOR SUPPORTED ALL AROUND BY COLUMNS SO THAT THERE ONE WAS ABLE TO PASS UNDER COVER THEIR VAULTS WERE CONSTRUCTED WITH PUMICE STONE AND PAVED WITH MOSAICS THE INNER WALLS WERE ENCRUSTED WITH NUMEROUS MIXED STONES ACCORDING TO THE REMAINS WHICH ARE STILL VISIBLE TODAY SOME WOULD HAVE IT THAT IN THE TIME OF POPE PAUL III THERE WERE REDISCOVERED IN THE AFOREMENTIONED COURTYARD VERY BEAUTIFUL FRAGMENTS OF STATUES AND ANIMALS WHICH IN ANCIENT TIMES WERE ALL ONE PIECE WHICH THE CARDINAL FARNESE HAD SET UP RECENTLY IN HIS PALACE ROME SPECIAL COLLECTIONS RESEARCH CENTER UNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO TOWARD THE WEST AND THE TIBER BECAUSE IT IS VERY RUINED ONE CANNOT SEE ANYTHING OTHER THAN THE BROKEN WALLS EVEN THOUGH HISTORICALLY ON THE SUMMIT THERE WERE BEAUTIFUL TEMPLES AND EDIFICES AT THE LETTER A SOME WOULD HAVE IT THAT THERE WERE SALT FIELDS TODAY THIS PLACE IS NAMED LA MARMORATA BECAUSE HERE DIFFERENT STONES OF MIXED TYPE AND MARBLE ARE UNLOADED WHICH ONE FINDS AT THE PORT OF OSTIA AT THE LETTER B IS THE OTHER BANK OF THE RIVER WHERE ALL THE VESSELS AND MERCHANTS THAT COME BY THE SEA TO ROME ARRIVE LOWER RIGHT 23 ROME SPECIAL COLLECTIONS RESEARCH CENTER UNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO UBLII F ILII CLA UDIA MELAE HAEREDIS ET PONTHI L IBERTI NOTE IN THE 5TH LINE OF THE INSCRIPTION ON THE PRINT LDQUO HAEREDIS RDQUO SHOULD BE SPELLED LDQUO HEREDIS RDQUO AND LDQUO PONTHI RDQUO SHOULD BE CIL VI 1374 CF VI 31639 ET VI P 3805 ET VI P 4688 CAIUS CESTIUS EPULO SON OF LUCIUS FROM THE TRIBE PUBLILIA PRAETOR PLEBEIAN TRIBUNE ONE OF THE SEVEN PRIESTS IN CHARGE OF RELIGIOUS BANQUETS IS BURIED HERE THE WORK WAS COMPLETED IN 330 DAYS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE WILL OF THE DECEASED UNDER THE DIRECTION OF PONTIUS MELA PUBLIUS S SON AND HEIR FROM THE TRIBE CLAUDIA AND OF THE FREEDMAN POTHOS LOWER LEFT VESTIGII D UNA PIRAMIDE DI MARMORO CHE FU UN SEPOLCRO DI C CESTIO SETTENVIRO DE GLI EPULONI QUALI EPULONI FURONO CERTI SACERDOTI DI GIOVE SI VEDE OGGIDI MURATA CON LE MURA DELLA CITTA PRESSO LA VIA HOSTIENSE FU ANTICHAMENTE QUESTA PIRAMIDE FUORA DELLA CITTA PER ESSER A QUEL TEMPO IL CIRCUITO DI ROMA MINORE DI QUELLO CHE SI VEDE OGGIDI VESTIGII D UNA PIRAMIDE DI MARMORO CHE FU UN SEPOLCRO DI C AIO CESTIO SETTENVIRO DE GLI EPULONI QUALI EPULONI FURONO CERTI SACERDOTI DI GIOVE SI VEDE OGGIDI MURATA CON LE MURA DELLA CITTA PRESSO LA PORTA DE SAN PAOLO SOPRA LA VIA HOSTIENSE FU ANTICHAMENTE QUESTA PIRAMIDE FUORA DELLA CITTA PER ESSER A QUEL TEMPO IL CIRCUITO DI ROMA MINORE DI QUELLO CHE SI VEDE OGGIDI REMAINS OF A MARBLE PYRAMID WHICH WAS A SEPULCHER OF GAIUS CESTIUS SEPTEMVIR OF THE EPULONES THE EPULONES WERE CERTAIN PRIESTS OF JUPITER ONE SEES IT TODAY WALLED IN BY THE CITY WALLS NEAR THE PORTA SAN PAOLO ABOVE THE VIA OSTIENSIS THIS PYRAMID WAS HISTORICALLY OUTSIDE THE CITY BECAUSE IT WAS BUILT AT A TIME WHEN THE PERIMETER OF ROME WAS SMALLER THAN IT IS TODAY ROME SPECIAL COLLECTIONS RESEARCH CENTER UNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO DG62 5 L2 CHICAGO UNITED STATES 21 9 X 38 5 CM CURTIUS AND ALSO THAT THE ANIO NOVUS BE BROUGHT FROM THE 62ND MILESTONE INTO THE CITY OF ROME IN UTROQUE LATERE TI BERIUS CLAUDIUS DRUSI F ILIUS CAISAR AUGUSTUS GERMANICUS PONTIF EX MAXIM US CONSUL ELECT FOR THE 4TH TIME FATHER OF THE FATHERLAND RESTORED AT HIS OWN EXPENSE FOR THE CITY OF ROME THE AQUEDUCTS LED FROM THE CURTIUS AND CAERULUS BY THE DIVINE CLAUDIUS AND SINCE INTERRUPTED AND IMPEN SA CUR AVIT NOTE IN THIS PRINT IN THE FIRST LINE OF THIS INSCRIPTION LDQUO TRIBUNICIA RDQUO SHOULD BE ABBREVIATED TO LDQUO TRIBUNIC RDQUO IN THE LAST LINE ON THE PRINT SEVERAL WORDS ARE ABBREVIATED WHICH ARE NOT IN THE ACTUAL INSCRIPTION COMPARE LDQUO FOR MA REDUC ENDAS SUA IMPEN SA CUR AVIT RDQUO TO THE FINAL LINE OF THE SOURCE TEXT BELOW EMPEROR TITUS CLAUDIUS VESPASIAN AUGUSTUS SON OF THE DIVINE VESPASIAN PONTIFEX MAXIMUS INVESTED WITH THE TRIBUNICAN POWER TEN TIMES HAILED IMPERATOR SEVENTEEN TIMES FATHER OF THE FATHERLAND CENSOR CONSUL FOR THE 8TH TIME AT HIS OWN EXPENSE PROVIDED THAT THE CURTIAN AND CAERULEAN WATERS THAT HAD BEEN BROUGHT FORTH BY THE DIVINE CLAUDIUS AND AFTERWARDS HAD BEEN RESTORED FOR THE CITY OF ROME BY HIS FATHER THE DIVINE VESPASIAN SINCE THEY HAD FALLED INTO DISREPAIR AT THE SOURCE OF THE WATERS FROM THE VERY FOUNDATION BECAUSE OF AGE BE BROUGHT BACK AGAIN BUT IN A NEW CHANNEL IN UTROQUE LATERE IMP ERATOR T ITUS CAESAR DIVI F ILIUS VESPASIANUS AUGUSTUS PONTIFEX MAXIMUS TRIBUNIC IA POTESTATE X IMPERATOR X V I I PATER PATRIAE CENSOR CO N SUL VIII AQUAS CURTIAM ET CAERULEAM PERDUCTAS A DIVO CLAUDIO ET POSTEA A DIVO VESPASIANO PATRE SUO URBI RESTITUTAS CUM A CAPITE AQUARUM A SOLO VETUSTATE DILAPSAE ESSENT NOVA FORMA REDUCENDAS SUA IMPENSA CURAVIT CIL VI 1258 CF VI P 3129 ET VI P 3798 ET VI P 4365 LOWER LEFT VESTIGII DUNA PORTA DE LA CITTA CHIAMATA ANTICHAMENTE PORTA NEVIA HORA DETTA PORTA MAGGIORE QUALLE SERVIVA ANCO PER CASTELLO DA RICEVERE DIVERSI ACQUE CHE VENIVANO CON AQUEDOTTI INTRARE IN ROMA PER DETTA PORTA COME SE NE VEDE OGGI GLI VESTIGII QUESTO EDIFITIO E DI PIETRA DI TRAVERTINO D OPERA CORINTHIA RUSTICHA LAVORATA DELLA PARTE DI DENTRO ET DI FUORA CON MEDESSIMO LAVORO E INSCRIPTIONE DA QUESTA PORTA ESCONO DUE STRADE LA LAVICANA E LA PRENESTINA REMAINS OF A CITY GATE HISTORICALLY CALLED PORTA NEVIA AND NOW CALLED PORTA MAGGIORE WHICH SERVED ALSO AS A CASTLE TO RECEIVE VARIOUS WATERS WHICH ARRIVED WITH AQUEDUCTS ENTERING ROME BY THE AFOREMENTIONED GATE AS ONE SEES TODAY THE REMAINS OF THIS EDIFICE ARE OF TRAVERTINE STONE OF RUSTIC CORINTHIAN ORDER WORKED IN PART INSIDE AND OUTSIDE WITH THE SAME WORK AND INSCRIPTIONS FROM THIS GATE LEAVE TWO STREETS VIA LAVICANA AND VIA PRENESTINA ROME SPECIAL COLLECTIONS RESEARCH CENTER UNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO DG62 5 L2 CHICAGO UNITED STATES 25 2 X 38 5 CM SHEET SERVO NO LI FRATI DI S ANT A CROCE PER GIARDINO REMAINS OF AN AMPHITHEATER NAMED CASTRENSE BY THE ANCIENTS WHICH IS JOINED WITH THE CITY WALL AND INSIDE THE MONASTERY OF SANTA CROCE IN GERUSALEMME THIS EDIFICE WAS AN OVAL SHAPE IT IS MADE ALL OF TERRACOTTA ADORNED WITH HALF RELIEF COLUMNS AND PILASTERS OF CORINTHIAN ORDER ONE CAN SEE THAT IT IS VERY ANCIENT BY THE MANNER OF WORK IT WAS ALSO VERY SMALL IN REGARD TO THE OTHERS THAT WERE IN ROME TODAY THE BROTHERS OF SANTA CROCE USE IT AS A GARDEN LOWER RIGHT 26 ROME SPECIAL COLLECTIONS RESEARCH CENTER UNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO DG62 5 L2 OR RATHER JULIA WHICH IS SO CALLED THE PLACE WHERE THE WATER OF THE AQUEDUCTS GATHERS WHICH SERVED TO DISTRIBUTE THE AFOREMENTIONED WATER TO DIFFERENT PARTS OF THE CITY ABOVE THIS EDIFICE AT THE LETTER A ARE TODAY TWO MARBLE TROPHIES WHICH ACCORDING TO SOME AUTHORS WERE ERECTED IN HONOR OF MARIUS FOR THE VICTORY WHICH GAINED CONTROL OF THE CIMBRI PEOPLE AT THE LETTER B IS VIA TIBURTINA WHICH GOES TO PORTA SANTO LORENZO AND AT THE LETTER C IS VIA PRENESTINA WHICH GOES TO PORTA MAGGIORE ROME SPECIAL COLLECTIONS RESEARCH CENTER UNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO DG62 5 L2 CHICAGO UNITED STATES 22 3 X 38 LE ADORNORONO DI BELLISSIME STATUE DI STUCCHI DI PITTURE ET TANTO LI PAVIMENTI COME LI MURI DI PORFIDI SERPENTINI ET REMAINS OF THE BATHS OF DIOCLETIAN OF THE OUTER PART WHICH LOOKS TOWARD THE SOUTHWEST AND ROME THIS WAS BEGUN BY EMPEROR MAXIMIAN AND AFTER HIS DEATH WAS FINISHED BY DIOCLETIAN THEN CONSTANTINE AND MAXIMIAN HIS SONS ADORNED IT WITH BEAUTIFUL STATUES OF STUCCO AND PAINTINGS RSQUO VERO LUOGO DOVE ERANO VARII INTERTENIMENTI DI PITURA ET SCULTURA ADORNATA DI GRANDISSIME COLONE DI GRANITO CON LE LOR MEMBRI REMAINS OF THE BATHS OF DIOCLETIAN THE INNER PART FACING SOUTHEAST IN WHICH ONE CAN UNDERSTAND BY THE IMMENSE HEIGHT AND ENORMITY OF THE VAULTS THE MAGNIFICENCE AND GRANDNESS OF THIS EDIFICE AT THE LETTER A WAS AN ATRIUM OR RATHER A COURTYARD WITH COLUMNS SURROUNDING IT WHICH SUPPORTED A CORRIDOR THAT ALLOWED ONE TO PASS UNDER COVER THE FLOOR WAS MADE OF NUMEROUS MIXED STONES WHICH MADE BEAUTIFUL COMPARTMENTS WORKED IN MOSAICS AT THE LETTER B IS THE PICTURE GALLERY OR RATHER THE PLACE WHERE VARIOUS EXEMPLARS OF PAINTINGS AND SCULPTURES WERE ADORNED WITH HUGE GRANITE COLUMNS WITH THEIR COMPONENTS ROME SPECIAL COLLECTIONS RESEARCH CENTER UNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO DG62 QUESTO EDIFICIO IL FONTONE DI NERONE PART OF QUIRINAL HILL FACING WEST WHERE AT THE LETTER A ARE THE REMAINS OF TWO LARGE STAIRCASES WHICH GO FROM THE FOOT TO THE SUMMIT OF THE HILL WHERE THERE WERE VARIOUS EDIFICES AT THE LETTER B ARE THE REMAINS OF THE TEMPLE OF THE SUN WHICH ACCORDING TO SOME WAS BUILT BY EMPEROR AURELIUS TO BE VERY LARGE AS ITS FRAGMENTS STILL SHOW BETWEEN THESE MANY BASES OF LARGE COLUMNS WERE FOUND IN EXCAVATION FROM ONE OF THESE THEY WANTED TO MAKE THE BASIN OF THE FOUNTAIN OF THE PEOPLE THE PEOPLE CALL THIS EDIFICE THE FOUNTAIN OF NERO ROME SPECIAL COLLECTIONS RESEARCH OF CONSTANTINE ON THE QUIRINAL HILL THE PART THAT LOOKS SOUTHWEST BECAUSE IT IS VERY RUINED THE ORNAMENTATION IS NO LONGER VISIBLE THERE EXCEPT FOR LARGE WALLS AND ROOMS IN THE GARDEN OF THE ILLUSTRIOUS CARDINAL VERCELLO AND AFTER I DREW THIS PART THEY BUILT HOUSES AND GRANARIES IN SUCH A WAY THAT TODAY ONE CANNOT SEE IT BECAUSE IT IS OCCUPIED BY THESE PLACES ROME SPECIAL COLLECTIONS CHIAMONO DI SANTO BARTHOLOMEO PER ESSER LA CHIESA DI QUESTO SANTO POSTA IN DETTA ISOLA VESTIGII DELLA ISOLA DI S AN TO BARTHOLOMEO GIA ANTICAMENTE DETTA L ISOLA DI GIOVE LICAONIO O RSQUO VER DI ESCULAPIO PER HAVERCI QUELLI DEI I LORO TEMPII FU FATTA DETTA ISOLA IN FORMA D RSQUO UNA NAVE O RSQUO GALERA COME SE NE VEDONO ANCHO OGGIDI VESTIGII QUALI SI MOSTRANO PER L RSQUO INFRASCRITTI SEG A ERA LA PLATEA DOVE ERA SOPRA FABRICATA DETTA NAVE B LA PARTE DE LA POPPA DI ESSA C IL PONTE FABRITIO HOGGI DETTO DE QUATRO CAPPI D IL PONTE CESTIO HORA IL CHIAMONO DI S AN TO BARTHOLOMEO PER ESSER LA CHIESA DI QUESTO SANTO POSTA IN DETTA ISOLA REMAINS OF THE ISLAND OF SAINT BARTHOLOMEW HISTORICALLY CALLED THE ISLAND OF JUPITER LIYCAONIUS OR RATHER OF AESCULAPIUS BECAUSE IT HELD THESE GODS AND THEIR TEMPLES THE AFOREMENTIONED ISLAND WAS MADE IN THE SHAPE OF A SHIP OR PRISON THE REMAINS OF WHICH ARE VISIBLE TODAY BY THE INSCRIPTIONS HELLIP A WAS THE FRONT OF THE HOUSE OVER WHICH THE SHIP WAS BUILT B THE PART OF THE STERN OF THIS C THE PONS FABRICIUS TODAY CALLED PONTE QUATTRO CAPI D THE PONS CESTIUS TODAY NAMED FOR SAINT BARTHOLOMEW BECAUSE THE CHURCH OF THIS SAINT IS ON THE ISLAND ROME NUMBERS 6 AND 9 THE REMAINING THREE NUMBERS 4 7 AND 13 BEAR THE MONOGRAM OF AGOSTINO VENEZIANO MOST OF THE ENGRAVINGS LISTED HERE BEAR THE SIGNATURE OF THE PUBLISHER ANTONIO SALAMANCA THEY PROBABLY BELONG TO THE CATEGORY OF THOSE ENGRAVINGS WHICH WERE RETOUCHED BY FRANCESCO VILLAMENA CF BA V 15 P 212 NUMBERS 2 5 12 AND 15 OF THE SET WERE LEFT UNSIGNED BY THE PUBLISHER THE INSCRIPTION OF EACH ENGRAVING CONSISTS OF AN OTTAVA COMPOSED BY AN UNKNOWN POET PROBABLY BEFORE 1550 NOT MENTIONED IN UGO DE MARIA S STUDY OF THE FABLE CF LA FAVOLA DE CUPIDO E PSICHE NELLA LETTERATURA E NELL ARTE ITALIANA BOLOGNA 1899 P 79F NUMBERS 2 AND 5 OF THIS SET LACK THE OTTAVE ALTOGETHER AND APPARENTLY BELONG TO AN EARLIER STAGE CF BA V 15 P 212 AND VIENNA P 54 THIS SET WAS ALSO ENGRAVED BY JACQUES ANDROUET DU CERCEAU CF L A V L P 39F N 1 32 PSYCHE BEING CARRIED UP TO A DESERTED MOUNTAIN ENGRAVING N 5 B 319 ROME SPECIAL COLLECTIONS RESEARCH CENTER UNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO DG62 5 L2 CHICAGO UNITED 1624 PART OF A SET OF 32 NUMBERED ENGRAVINGS THOSE MISSING WITH THE EXCEPTION OF NUMBERS 7 AND 9 OF THE SET CAN BE FOUND IN THE RAPHAEL VOLUME LISTED ABOVE TWENTY NINE OF THESE ENGRAVINGS WERE EXECUTED BY MASTER B IN THE DIE THOUGH HIS MONOGRAM ONLY APPEARS ON NUMBERS 6 AND 9 THE REMAINING THREE NUMBERS 4 7 AND 13 BEAR THE MONOGRAM OF AGOSTINO VENEZIANO MOST OF THE ENGRAVINGS LISTED HERE BEAR THE SIGNATURE OF THE PUBLISHER ANTONIO SALAMANCA THEY PROBABLY BELONG TO THE CATEGORY OF THOSE ENGRAVINGS WHICH WERE RETOUCHED BY FRANCESCO VILLAMENA CF BA V 15 P 212 NUMBERS 2 5 12 AND 15 OF THE SET WERE LEFT UNSIGNED BY THE PUBLISHER THE INSCRIPTION OF EACH ENGRAVING CONSISTS OF AN OTTAVA COMPOSED BY AN UNKNOWN POET PROBABLY BEFORE 1550 NOT MENTIONED IN UGO DE MARIA S STUDY OF THE FABLE CF COXIE MICHIEL ENGRAVER PRINTMAKER SALAMANCA ANTONIO PUBLISHER VILLAMENA FRANCESCO PUBLISHER 1538 1562 OR CA 1590 1624 1538 1624 PART OF A SET OF 32 NUMBERED ENGRAVINGS THOSE MISSING WITH THE EXCEPTION OF NUMBERS 7 AND 9 OF THE SET CAN BE FOUND IN THE RAPHAEL VOLUME LISTED ABOVE TWENTY NINE OF THESE ENGRAVINGS WERE EXECUTED BY MASTER B IN THE DIE THOUGH HIS MONOGRAM ONLY APPEARS ON NUMBERS 6 AND 9 THE REMAINING THREE NUMBERS 4 7 AND 13 BEAR THE MONOGRAM OF AGOSTINO VENEZIANO MOST OF THE ENGRAVINGS LISTED HERE BEAR THE SIGNATURE OF THE PUBLISHER ANTONIO SALAMANCA THEY PROBABLY BELONG TO THE GIOVANNI GIACOMO DE ROSSI AND THEN AGAIN IN 1693 BY DOMENICO DE ROSSI BARTOLI APPARENTLY RE ENGRAVED AND ENLARGED FRANCOIS PERRIER S ICONES ET SEGMENTA ILLUSTRIUM E MARMORE TABULARUM FIRST PUBLISHED ROMANARUM ANTIQUITATUM AC VETERIS SCULPTURAE VESTIGIA ANAGLYPHICO OPERE ELABORATA EX MARMOREIS EXEMPLARIBUS QUAE ROMAE ADHUC EXTANT ARA SEU BASIS QUADRATA LATERIBUS SINGULIS ANABLYPHICE SCULPTA ET A QUODAM TIBERIO CLAUDIO FAVENTINO DICATA EADEMQUE IMAGINIBUS DECORATA ORIGINEM AC PRIMORDIA URBIS ROMAE A PARIDIS POMO AD LUPAM LACTANTEM PUEROS QUASI AB OVO REPRAESENTAT UPPER LEFT MERCURIUS DAT PARIDI AUREUM DISCORDIAE POMUM UT DE FORMA CONTENDENTIBUS DEABUS PALLADE IUNONE AN VENERE PULCHRIORI DONET HINC TROIE ASIAEQUE INCENDIA MERCURY GIVES THE GOLDEN APPLE OF DISCORD TO PARIS SO THAT HE MAY GIVE IT TO THE MOST BEAUTIFUL OF THE GODDESSES DISPUTING THEIR BEAUTY PALLAS JUNO AND VENUS FROM THIS SOURCE THE CONFLAGRATION OF ASIA AND TROY UPPER RIGHT HECTOR ACHILLIS TELO PROSTRATUS VELOCIBUS EQUIS RAPTATUR CIRCA TROIAE MUROS SIC RELIGATIS PEDIBUS INCURRU UT EXTRA DIMISSO PECTORE CAPUT IN PULUERE TRAHATUR TROADES HECUBA MATER ANDROMACHE CONIUX PALMAS TENDUNT AC QUESTUS FUNDUNT HECTOR SLAIN BY THE SPEAR OF ACHILLES IS DRAGGED AROUND THE WALLS OF TROY BY SWIFT HORSES THUS HIS FEET TIED TO THE CHARIOT SO THAT THE HEAD MAY BE DRAGGED IN THE DUST HIS CHEST FORSAKEN THE TROJANS HECUBA HIS MOTHER ANDROMACHE HIS WIFE EXTEND THEIR PALMS AND POUR FORTH LAMENTATION CENTER LEFT ACRE PRAELIUM CIRCA PATROCLI CADAVER AB HECTORE INTEREMPTI UT ADIUVANTE MINERVA ERIPERENT GRECI ET IUSTA SOLUERENT AD NAVES TROIANI VERO UT AD URBEM TRAHERENT VICTORIAE THE GREEKS RESCUE THE BODY OF THE SLAIN PATROCLUS FROM HECTOR IN THE MIDST OF THE BITTER BATTLE AND OFFER FUNERAL RITES NEAR THE SHIPS HOWEVER THE TROJANS HAUL THE TROPHIES OF VICTORY INTO THE CITY CENTER RIGHT AD PARENTANDUM PATROCLO BOVES IMMOLANDOS ET EQUOS AD CURSUM ET FUNEBRES LUDOS SOLEMNI POMPA DUCUNT SACRORUM MINISTRI IN ORDER TO MAKE OFFERINGS TO THE DEAD PATROCLES THE MINISTERS OF THE RELIGIOUS RITES ORDER CATTLE TO BE SACRIFICED HORSES TO BE LED IN RACES AND FUNERARY GAMES WITH SOLEMN POMP LOWER LEFT ACHILLES ACCEPTIS A MATRE THETIDE ARMIS VULCANI MANU ELABORATIS ARMATUS IN CURRU ADVERSUS TROES INSURGIT UT DE MORTE PATROCLI PENAS SUMAT EIUSQUE MANIBUS HECTOREM IMMOLET ACHILLES HIS ARMS RECEIVED FROM HIS MOTHER THETIS AND BESTOWED WITH THE CARE OF THE HAND OF VULCAN RISES UP IN A CHARIOT AGAINST TROY SO THAT HE MAY INCUR THE PENALTY FOR THE DEATH OF PATROCLES AND IMMOLATE HECTOR WITH HIS HANDS LOWER RIGHT SACERDOTES DE MORE VELATI VICTIMAM PROSEQUUNTUR VICTIMARIUS TIBICEN LONGAM FUNEREAM TIBIAM INFLAT THE VEILED PRIESTS FOLLOW THE VICTIM ACCORDING TO CUSTOM THE ATTENDANT FLUTE PLAYER BLOWS UPON 1 THE PRIESTESS OF ISIS OR THE VERY DEFENDING GODDESS HOLDS BY ONE HAND THE URN BY THE OTHER THE SNAKE COILED AROUND HER LOWER ARM IN CIRCLES ITS HEAD ERECT A SIGN OF THE HEALTH OF THE GODDESS 2 ISIACUS HOLDING THE BOOK BY BOTH HANDS SINGS AN INCANTATION IN HONOR OF GOD WRAPPED IN A TUNIC HE LAYS BARE THE UPPER PART OF HIS BODY UP TO THE NAVEL FOR THE CELESTIAL AND PROPHETIC PRIESTS OF EGYPT PROFESS TO THE MORTALS WHO REMAIN THAT THEY KNOW ONLY OBSCURE THINGS THE PORTENT CARRIES THE WINGS OF THE SUN HAWK BY WHICH THEY UNDERSTAND THE SOUL OF THE WORLD AND THE GESTURE OF GOD IN ALL THINGS 3 THE PRELATE OF THE RITES SHAVED AND WRAPPED IN A WHITE LINEN GARMENT CARRIERS A WATER POT FILLED WITH WATER WHICH HE EMBRACES BY THE FOREARMS OBSERVED IN POMP FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE FRUITFULNESS OF NONE HE COVERS HIS FEET IN SHOES MADE OF PAPER COVERED IN THE LEAVES OF PALMS ABOUT WHICH APULEIUS AND PLUTARCH REPORT 4 ISIACA SHAKING THE RATTLE OF ISIS BY THE RIGHT HAND GIVES SOUND WHOSE INCREASE INTO AN EARTHQUAKE IMITATES THE REGULAR ROTATIONS OF THE MOON UNDER WHICH ALL THINGS MOVE ARE BEGET AND DESTROYED SHE HOLDS BY THE LEFT HAND THE LADLE FOR LIBATIONS DURING THE RITES LOWER RIGHT 16 DUODECIM MENSIBUS DESIGNANT THE MARBLE TEMPLE OF JANUS IN THE FORUM BOARIUM NEAR SAN GIORGIO IN VELABRO HAS FOUR GATES AND IN THE FRONTISPIECE OF EACH OF THEM THERE ARE 12 NICHES WHICH DESIGNATE THE MISSING BETWEEN PIUS AND PERTINAX IN THE SECOND LINE ON THE PRINT THE FIRST WORD PONTIFEX IS AN ERRONEOUS INCLUSION MISSING IN THE SECOND LINE ARE THE PHRASES IMP ERATOR XI AND P ATER P ATRIAE THE TITLE OF THE EMPEROR COMMODUS ALSO DIVERGE FROM THE ORIGINAL ANTONINUS IS ERRONEOUSLY ABBREVIATED IN THE PRINT AND THE TITLE AUG USTUS IS MISSING WHILE PONTIFEX MAXIMUS AND P ATER P ATRIAE ARE ERRONEOUS INCLUSIONS COMPARE THIS TRANSCRIPTION WITH THE SOURCE TEXT BELOW IMP ERATOR CAES AR L UCIUS SEPTI MIUS SEVERUS PIUS FELIX PERTINAX AUG USTUS ARABIC US ADIA B E N I C US PAR THIC US MAXIMUS CAERULEI ET CURTII ANIENIS QUOQ UE NONI A CALIGULA IMP ERATOR INCHOATUS ET A CLAUDIO ABSOLUTUS AQUA CLAUDIA INDE DICTUS A PORTA ESQILINA PER COELII MONTIS DORSUM IN AVENTINUM PERDUCEBATUR HODIE PORTA MAIOR APPELLATUR AQUEDUCT OF THE SPRINGS OF THE CAERULEUS AND THE CURTIUS AND OF THE ANIO NOVUS INITIATED BY EMPEROR CALIGULA AND FINISHED BY CLAUDIUS MDASH AND THUS CALLED AQUA CLAUDIA MDASH WHICH IS LEAD FROM THE PORTA ESQUILINA THROUGH THE BACK OF THE CAELIAN HILL TILL THE AVENTINE IT IS CALLED TODAY PORTA MAGGIORE UPPER TI CLAUDIUS DRUSI F C ISAR AUGUSTUS GERMANICUS PONTIF MAXIM TRIBUNICIA POTESTATE XII CO N S UL V IMPERATOR XXVII PATER PATRIAE AQUAS CLAUDIAM EX FONTIBUS QUI VOCABANTUR CAERULEUS ET CURTIUS A MILLIARIO XXXXV ITEM ANIENEM NOVAM A MILLIARIO LXII SUA IMPENSA IN URBEM PERDUCENDAS CURAVIT TIBERIUS CLAUDIUS CAESAR AUGUSTUS GERMANICUS SON OF DRUSUS PONTIFEX MAXIMUS INVESTED WITH THE TRIBUNICAN POWER TWELVE TIMES CONSUL FOR THE 5TH TIME HAILED IMPERATOR 27 TIMES FATHER OF THE FATHERLAND PROVIDED FOR AT HIS OWN EXPENSE THAT THE CLAUDIAN AQUEDUCT BE BROUGHT FROM THE 45TH MILESTONE FROM THE SPRINGS WHICH ARE CALLED THE CAERULEUS AND THE CURTIUS AND ALSO THAT THE ANIO NOVUS BE BROUGHT FROM THE 62ND MILESTONE INTO THE CITY OF ROME IN UTROQUE LATERE TI BERIUS CLAUDIUS DRUSI F ILIUS CAISAR AUGUSTUS GERMANICUS PONTIF EX MAXIM US TRIBUNICIA POTESTATE X I I CO N S UL V IMPERATOR X X V I I PATER PATRIAE AQUAS CLAUDIAM EX FONTIBUS QUI VOCABANTUR CAERULEUS ET CURTIUS A MILLIARIO XXXXV ITEM ANIENEM NOVAM A MILLIARIO LXII SUA IMPENSA IN URBEM PERDUCENDAS CURAVIT CIL VI 1256 CF VI P 3129 ET VI P 3798 ET VI P 4365 MIDDLE IMP CAESAR VESPASIANUS AUGUST PONTIF MAX TRIB POT II IMP VI COS III DESIG IIII P P AQUAS CURTIAM ET CAERULEAM PERDUCTAS A DIVO CLAUDIO ET POSTEA INTERMISSAS DILAPSAS QUE PER ANNOS NOVEM SUA IMPENSA URBI RESTITUIT IMPERATOR CAESAR VESPASIANUS AUGUSTUSTUS PONTIFEX MAXIMUS TRIBUNICIA POTESTATE II IMPERATOR VI CONSUL III DESIGNATUS IIII PATER PATRIAE AQUAS CURTIAM ET CAERULEAM PERDUCTAS A DIVO CLAUDIO ET POSTEA INTERMISSAS DILAPSAS QUE PER ANNOS NOVEM SUA IMPENSA URBI RESTITUIT IMP ERATOR CAESAR VESPASIANUS AUGUST US PONTIF EX MAX IMUS TRIB UNICIA POT ESTATE II IMP ERATOR VI CO N S UL III DESIG NATUS IIII P ATER P ATRIAE AQUAS CURTIAM ET CAERULEAM PERDUCTAS A DIVO CLAUDIO ET POSTEA INTERMISSAS DILAPSASQUE PER ANNOS NOVEM SUA IMPENSA URBI RESTITUIT THE EMPEROR CAESAR VESPASIAN AUGUSTUS PONTIFEX MAXIMUS INVESTED WITH THE TRIBUNICAN POWER TWO TIMES HAILED IMPERATOR SIX TIMES CONSUL ELECT FOR THE 4TH TIME FATHER OF THE FATHERLAND RESTORED AT HIS OWN EXPENSE FOR THE CITY OF ROME THE AQUEDUCTS LED FROM THE CURTIUS AND CAERULUS BY THE DIVINE CLAUDIUS AND SINCE INTERRUPTED AND RUINED FOR NINE YEARS IN UTROQUE LATERE IMP ERATOR CAESAR VESPASIANUS AUGUST US PONTIF EX MAX IMUS TRIB UNICIA POT ESTATE I I IMP ERATOR V I CO N S UL I I I DESIG NATUS I I I I P ATER P ATRIAE AQUAS CURTIAM ET CAERULEAM PERDUCTAS A DIVO CLAUDIO ET POSTEA INTERMISSAS DILAPSASQUE PER ANNOS NOVEM SUA IMPENSA URBI RESTITUIT CIL VI 1257 CF VI P 3129 ET VI P 3798 ET VI P 4365 LOWER IMP T CAESAR DIVI F VESPASIANUS AUGUSTUS PONTIFEX MAXIMUS TRIBUNIC POTESTATE X IMPERATOR XVII PATER PATRIAE CENSOR COS VIII AQUAS CURTIAM ET CAERULEAM PERDUCATAS A DIVO CLAUDIO ET POSTEA A DIVO VESPASIANO PATRE SUO URBI RESTITUTAS CUM A CAPITE AQUARUM A SOLO VETUSTATE DILAPSAE ESSENT NOVA FORMA REDUCENDAS SUA IMPENSA CURAVIT IMPERATOR TITUS CAESAR DIVI FILIUS VESPASIANUS AUGUSTUS PONTIFEX MAXIMUS TRIBUNICIA POTESTATE X IMPERATOR XVII PATER PATRIAE CENSOR CONSUL VIII AQUAS CURTIAM ET CAERULEAM PERDUCATAS A DIVO CLAUDIO ET POSTEA A DIVO VESPASIANO PATRE SUO URBI RESTITUTAS CUM A CAPITE AQUARUM A SOLO VETUSTATE DILAPSAE ESSENT NOVA FORMA REDUCENDAS SUA IMPENSA CURAVIT IMP ERATOR T ITUS CAESAR DIVI F ILIUS VESPASIANUS AUGUSTUS PONTIFEX MAXIMUS TRIBUNIC IA POTESTATE X IMPERATOR XVII PATER PATRIAE CENSOR CO N S UL VIII AQUAS CURTIAM ET CAERULEAM PERDUCTAS A DIVO CLAUDIO ET POSTEA A DIVO VESPASIANO PATRE SUO URBI RESTITUTAS CUM A CAPITE AQUARUM A SOLO VETUSTATE DILAPSAE ESSENT NOVA FORMA REDUCENDAS SUA IMPENSA CURAVIT EMPEROR TITUS CLAUDIUS VESPASIAN AUGUSTUS SON OF THE DIVINE VESPASIAN PONTIFEX MAXIMUS INVESTED WITH THE TRIBUNICAN POWER TEN TIMES HAILED IMPERATOR SEVENTEEN TIMES FATHER OF THE FATHERLAND CENSOR CONSUL FOR THE 8TH TIME AT HIS OWN EXPENSE PROVIDED THAT THE CURTIAN AND CAERULEAN WATERS THAT HAD BEEN BROUGHT FORTH BY THE DIVINE CLAUDIUS AND AFTERWARDS HAD BEEN RESTORED FOR THE CITY OF ROME BY HIS FATHER THE DIVINE VESPASIAN SINCE THEY HAD FALLED INTO DISREPAIR AT THE SOURCE OF THE WATERS FROM THE VERY FOUNDATION BECAUSE OF AGE BE BROUGHT BACK AGAIN BUT IN A NEW CHANNEL IN UTROQUE LATERE IMP ERATOR T ITUS CAESAR DIVI F ILIUS VESPASIANUS AUGUSTUS PONTIFEX MAXIMUS TRIBUNIC IA POTESTATE X IMPERATOR X V I I PATER PATRIAE CENSOR CO N SUL V I II AQUAS CURTIAM ET CAERULEAM PERDUCTAS A DIVO CLAUDIO ET POSTEA A DIVO THE MEDIEVAL PERIOD IT WAS BUILT INTO THE FORTRESS OF THE FRANGIPANI FAMILY THE ARCH WAS FREED FROM LATER CONSTRUCTIONS AND RESTORED IN 1822 FOR FURTHER INFORMATION SEE RICHARDSON PG 30 S V ARCUS TITI COMMONLY CALLED COLOSSEUM BECAUSE OF THE COLOSSAL STATUE OF NERO BETWEEN THE CAELIAN HILL AND THE ESQUILINE WHICH WAS INITIATED BY EMPEROR VESPASIAN AND LATER FINISHED AND DECORATED BY TITUS ROME OR SUMMU M FASTIGIUM 40 FENESTELLIS LUCEM ADMITTENTIBUS ASCENSU M PRAEBET ALTA PEDU M 120 IN SUMMO TRAIANI OSSA IN PILA AUREA CONDITA SERVABANTUR THE COLUMN OF THE EMPEROR TRAJAN SPIRAL IN STRUCTURE IN THE MIDDLE OF HIS FORUM AND WHICH CAN STILL BE SEEN STANDING TODAY IT PORTRAYS THE SUMMARY OF THE DEEDS CARRIED OUT BY TRAJAN CARVED WITH GREAT SKILL FIRST AMONG THEM THE DACIAN WAR WITHIN THE COLUMN 185 STEPS ALLOW ONE TO ASCEND TO THE TOP OF THE PEDIMENT WITH 40 SMALL WINDOWS ADMITTING LIGHT AT THE TOP AT A HEIGHT OF 120 FEET THE BONES OF TRAJAN USED TO BE KEPT HIDDEN WITHIN A GOLDEN SPHERE ENGRAVER PRINTMAKER GALLE PHILIP PUBLISHER GALLE THEODOOR PUBLISHER 1600 1600 1600 H VAN CLEVE S SIGNATURE AND MONOGRAM APPEAR ON ALL 38 ENGRAVINGS WITH THE EXCEPTION OF ENGRAVING N 22 OF THE SET C 554 WHICH LACKS THE MONOGRAM PHILIP GALLE S SIGNATURE ALSO APPEARS ON ALL THE ENGRAVINGS WHILE THAT OF HIS SON THEODOOR APPEARS ON ENGRAVING N 1 C 533 ONLY AN EARLIER EDITION OF THE RUINARUM PUBLISHED BY PH GALLE CA 1587 IS LISTED IN A B P 513 SUB ALBO E 108 THE SEQUENCE OF THE ENGRAVINGS IN THESE TWO EDITIONS IS NOT THE SAME ENGRAVING N 5 HENDRICK VAN CLEVE III MAY ALSO HAVE BEEN THE ENGRAVER AS HIS MONOGRAM IS PRESENT ON THE PRINT MAY HAVE BEEN REPUBLISHED AFTER 1600 BY THEODOOR GALLE C 537 RUINARUM VARII PROSPECTUS RURIUMQUE ALIQUOT DELINEATIONES THERMAE DIOCLETIANI ANTWERP SPECIAL PHILIP GALLE PUBLISHER THEODOOR GALLE REPUBLISHER CLEVE HENDRICK VAN III DESIGNER CLEVE HENDRICK VAN III ENGRAVER PRINTMAKER GALLE PHILIP PUBLISHER GALLE THEODOOR PUBLISHER 1600 1600 1600 H VAN CLEVE S SIGNATURE AND MONOGRAM APPEAR ON ALL 38 ENGRAVINGS WITH THE EXCEPTION OF ENGRAVING N 22 OF THE SET C 554 WHICH LACKS THE MONOGRAM PHILIP GALLE S SIGNATURE ALSO APPEARS ON ALL THE ENGRAVINGS WHILE THAT OF HIS SON THEODOOR APPEARS ON ENGRAVING N 1 C 533 ONLY AN EARLIER EDITION OF THE RUINARUM PUBLISHED BY PH GALLE CA 1587 IS LISTED IN A B P 513 SUB ALBO E 108 THE SEQUENCE OF THE ENGRAVINGS IN THESE TWO EDITIONS IS NOT THE SAME ENGRAVING N 15 HENDRICK VAN CLEVE III MAY ALSO HAVE BEEN THE ENGRAVER AS HIS MONOGRAM IS PRESENT ON THE PRINT PRINT MAY ALSO HAVE BEEN REPUBLISHED AFTER 1600 BY VAN III DESIGNER CLEVE HENDRICK VAN III ENGRAVER PRINTMAKER GALLE PHILIP PUBLISHER GALLE THEODOOR PUBLISHER 1600 1600 1600 H VAN CLEVE S SIGNATURE AND MONOGRAM APPEAR ON ALL 38 ENGRAVINGS WITH THE EXCEPTION OF ENGRAVING N 22 OF THE SET C 554 WHICH LACKS THE MONOGRAM PHILIP GALLE S SIGNATURE ALSO APPEARS ON ALL THE ENGRAVINGS WHILE THAT OF HIS SON THEODOOR APPEARS ON ENGRAVING N 1 C 533 ONLY AN EARLIER EDITION OF THE RUINARUM PUBLISHED BY PH GALLE CA 1587 IS LISTED IN A B P 513 SUB ALBO E 108 THE SEQUENCE OF THE ENGRAVINGS IN THESE TWO EDITIONS IS NOT THE SAME HENDRICK VAN CLEVE III MAY ALSO HAVE BEEN THE ENGRAVER AS HIS MONOGRAM IS PRESENT ON THE PRINT MAY HAVE BEEN REPUBLISHED AFTER 1600 BY THEODOOR GALLE ENGRAVING N 25 C 557 RUINARUM VARII PROSPECTUS RURIUMQUE ALIQUOT DELINEATIONES DELLA PUBLISHER SCHAYCK GOERT VAN PUBLISHER CA 1614 THOUGH DATED 1584 OR 1621 1614 1621 PART OF A SET OF 80 ENGRAVINGS WHICH WERE NUMBERED FOR THE FIRST TIME IN THE 1621 VAN SCHAYCK EDITION THE ENGRAVINGS INCLUDED IN OUR COLLECTION APPARENTLY COME FROM AN UNDETERMINED NUMBER OF DIFFERENT DELLA VACCHERIA VAN SCHAYCK EDITIONS THE ENGRAVING NUMBERS SUPPLIED DO NOT ALWAYS APPEAR ON THE PRINTS QUALE A VIRGILIO AC PLINIO SED CUIUSMODI A GRAECIS POETIS DESCRIBITUR A STATUE OF LAOCOON MADE FROM MARBLE WITH MARVELOUS ART IN THE POPE RSQUO S GARDEN IN ROME NOT OF THE TYPE WHICH IS DESCRIBED BY GENERAL NOTE P THIS ENGRAVING IS A DUPLICATE OF C 901 IT LACKS HOWEVER THE VARIOUS LEGENDS AND THE ORSINI ARMS CF ASHBY P 129 NOTE 1 AND LOWRY COL 50B AND NOTE 29 THE INSCRIPTION OF THIS STATUE IN THE CAVALIERI EDITIONS INCLUDING THE 1623 MARCUCCI ONE LOCATES IT IN FRONT OF THE HOUSE OF CARDINAL ALFONSO CARAFFA 1540 1567 WHO WAS MADE A CARDINAL ON MARCH 15 1557 CF EC V 3 COL 98A IN THE INSCRIPTION OF THE DELLA VACCHERIA VAN SCHAYCK EDITIONS THIS HOUSE HAD PASSED INTO THE HANDS OF A CARDINAL OF THE SERMONETTA BRANCH WHICH COULD MEAN ANY OF THE FOLLOWING MEMBERS OF THE CAETANI FAMILY WHO IN HEREDITARY SUCCESSION WERE CREATED CARDINALS NICOLO IN 1538 ENRICO IN 1589 BONFACIO II IN 1606 ANTONIO II IN 1621 AND LUIGI D 1642 THE LAST CARDINAL OF THAT FAMILY IN 1626 CF EI V 8 P 252 THE ENGRAVING OF THIS STATUE EXECUTED BY JACQUES GRANTHOMME CA 1597 IS WITHOUT AN INSCRIPTION BUT BEARS ON THE PEDESTAL WHAT APPEARS TO BE THE CARAFFA ARMS C 902 ANTIQUARUM STATUARUM URBIS ROMAE QUAE IN PUBLICIS PRIVATISQUE LOCIS VISUNTUR ICONES 80 ALEXANDRI MAGNI VULGO PASQUINUS EUM SOCIUM DETINENS ANTE AEDES SERMONAETIS CARD ROMANI ALEXANDRI MAGNI VULGO PASQUINUS EUM SOCIUM DETINENS ANTE AEDES
